results.title: The Woods
results.material_description: Multi-channel installation, video, colour and audio
results.brief_description: The Woods is a video installation comprised of three documentaries on child film stars from the United States of America, Nigeria and India. ‘The Audition’ features Hollywood stars, ‘The Interview’ features Nollywood stars, and ‘The Rehearsal’ features Bollywood stars. The Woods was exhibited at ACMI as part of The Character exhibition in 2015.
results.description: The Woods is a video installation comprised of three documentaries on child film stars from the United States of America, Nigeria and India. ‘The Audition’ features Hollywood stars, ‘The Interview’ features Nollywood stars, and ‘The Rehearsal’ features Bollywood stars. The Woods was exhibited at ACMI as part of The Character exhibition in 2015.

results.title: Tuktu and his animal friends
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
In this film we look at the smaller animals that live in the Arctic, including lemmings, weasels, ducks and kittiwakes. It also includes material on flowers. Tuktu’s father climbs the high cliffs in search of gulls’ eggs.

results.title: Tuktu and the magic spear
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Tuktu accompanies his family when fishing is done through the ice during the long cold winter. He also sees his father catch fish with a spear during the summer, Tuktu longs to grow up and spear fish too.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: You can't grow potatoes up there
results.creator_credit: Peter Crass and North West Territories Information
results.brief_description: Illustrates the importance of seal hunting in the traditional life of the Inuit Eskimo of Canada’s Arctic. Made on location with three groups of Inuit hunters, the films hows how their traditional existence has become dangerously threatened by anti-sealing publicity. Hunters show the different techniques used to hunt seal year round; the use that is made of the meat; and how the skins are prepared for sale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Crass and North West Territories Information
results.description: Illustrates the importance of seal hunting in the traditional life of the Inuit Eskimo of Canada’s Arctic. Made on location with three groups of Inuit hunters, the films hows how their traditional existence has become dangerously threatened by anti-sealing publicity. Hunters show the different techniques used to hunt seal year round; the use that is made of the meat; and how the skins are prepared for sale.

results.title: Tuktu and the magic bow
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
The Inuit in far-off times used the bow and arrow for hunting. We see a bow being made and how the Inuit practise their shooting skill by aiming arrows at snow men and snow bears. Tuktu’s father proves himself the best at this test of hunting skill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: You and Your Vote
results.creator_credit: Douglas White, Loch Townsend, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: In an attempt to overcome informal voting in Senate elections, an account is given of the work of the Electoral Office and the correct way in which a vote should be recorded.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Douglas White, Loch Townsend, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Tuktu and the ten thousand fishes
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Tuktu is taken on a fishing trip to the ancient stone weir. He sees his father and other hunters spear fish in great numbers, and watches his father and his uncle make fire with an Inuit fire drill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the big seal
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
A big seal gets away after being harpooned by Tuktu’s father. Perhaps it is the same seal that has, in the past, escaped the harpoons of other hunters. But Tuktu’s father does bring home a seal in the end.

results.title: Tuktu and his nice new clothes
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Tuktu and other children are shown being fitted for and dressed in warm winter clothes, beautifully made by the Inuit women. We see the cutting, stitching and use of Arctic clothing, and we learn how important it is for Inuit mothers to be clever seamstresses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
